metadata.titleEn: The oasis development dates of Tarim Basin
metadata.description: Oases around the Tarim Basin (TB), northwestern China, as key stations of the“Silk Road”in thehistoric time and the modern Silk Road Economic Belt, have been critical areas for human production and living since ancient times. It is crucial to investigate the process and mechanism of the evolution of these oases in the TB to explore the relationship between oasis evolution and human activities. Twenty-four publications on oasis and fluvial-lacustrine deposit sections in the basin since 28 ka were selected, including 262 oasis and 120 fluvial-lacustrine deposit dating results. These ages are of great significance to understanding the oases evolution and hydrological processes of Tarim Basin.

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to study the development ages of oasis sediments in the Tarim Basin?
Example.Answer: A data collection method involves selecting and analyzing literature that records oasis sediment sequences in the Tarim Basin since the Last Glacial Maximum. Researchers statistically analyze data from these sources, including 262 development ages of oasis sediments and 120 river and lake sediment development ages, to understand the evolution and hydrological processes of the oasis.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the characteristics of the data collection methods used to study the evolutionary process of oases in the Tarim Basin?
Feature Specification.Answer: 262 oasis sediment development ages, 120 river-lake sediment development ages

Quantification.Question: How many oasis sediment development ages are documented in the collected literature related to the Tarim Basin since the Last Glacial Maximum?

Interpretation.Question: What can be inferred about the evolution of oases in the Tarim Basin and their hydrological processes from the patterns found in the development ages of 262 oasis sediment sequences and 120 fluvial-lacustrine sediment development ages?
Interpretation.Answer: The development ages of oasis sediment sequences and fluvial-lacustrine sediments can reveal insights into the evolution process of oases in the Tarim Basin, including how these oases responded to climatic changes since the Last Glacial Maximum. By analyzing these ages, researchers can infer the mechanisms driving oasis evolution and the associated hydrological processes, which are crucial for understanding both historical and contemporary human habitation and the role of the region as a node on ancient and modern Silk Roads.
